thread.title: Husband and wife to face Sydney court on terrorism charges
thread.title_full: Husband and wife to face Sydney court on terrorism charges

title: Husband and wife to face Sydney court on terrorism charges
text:
Terrorism charges: Married couple, allegedly preparing an attack, to face court in Sydney Updated February 08, 2017 09:18:11 
A married couple will today face a Sydney court and be charged with planning a terrorist attack. 
The man and woman, both 19, are already on remand facing terrorism-related charges. 
The man is accused of collecting terrorism-related documents. 
Police allege his wife was found with a hunting knife and a Shahada flag in her handbag, as well as instructions for making a bomb detonator. 
The pair will now face a charge of planning to carry out a terrorist act â€” which carries a penalty of life in prison. 
They're expected to appear in Sydney's Central Local Court today. 
The fresh charges are part of the joint counter-terrorism team's operation "Chillon". 
More to come.
